intro: Nonatelia pubescens, commonly known as the hairy nonatelia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which provide a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, producing a pale yellow to greenish hue. Nonatelia pubescens is often found in moist, tropical environments and is adapted to thrive in shaded conditions.
